meanings.definition: To blow air forcefully or noisily.
meanings.sent1: The wind was blawing so hard that it knocked over the trash cans.
meanings.sent2: She was blawing bubbles with her bubble wand in the park.
meanings.sent3: The blawing wind made the trees dance in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The blawing of the whistle signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The blawing storm clouds gathered ominously in the sky.

meanings.sent1: He was blawing the leaves into a neat pile in the yard.
meanings.sent2: The kids were blawing up balloons for the party decorations.
meanings.sent3: The blawing of the hairdryer made her hair stand on end.
meanings.sent4: The blawing dust from the construction site settled on everything nearby.
meanings.sent5: The blawing leaves swirled around in a colorful whirlwind.

meanings.sent1: The blawing of the wind through the trees created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the blawing of the bubbles as they floated in the air.
meanings.sent3: The blawing of the birthday candles out was the highlight of the party.
meanings.sent4: The blawing of the whistle signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent5: The blawing of the wind carried the scent of flowers through the garden.
